entries.meaning: (grammar) Of or pertaining to the grammatical case used to indicate the patient or experiencer of a verbâ€™s action.
(rare) Of, exhibiting, or pertaining to absolution; absolutory, absolving.
examples: (1) Absolution: The speaker says the act was not what was understood, and that it did not occur as charged anyway. [...] His repeated denials should be  viewed as an absolutive strategy in which the facts themselves are disputed, [...]

entries.meaning: (grammar) The absolutive case, or a phrase that uses it.
(grammar) An uninflected verb form used to indicate another action performed by the subject of the principal verb.
